allReviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Not as Advertised.
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2025
allReviews.body: Advertisement said this phone was unlocked.  It wasn't.  In fact, after three days, almost 17 hours of talking on the phone with Assurance, they still could not fully unlock the phone.Also, I did not receive the pointer to take out the SIM tray.  Also, I did not receive a manual.  I understand it was rebuilt, but there had to be a way to provide something.The box did not tell me what the IMEI was.  I had to charge the phone to turn it on, to search for this information on the phone.  According to Assurance Wireless, this was not an Assurance phone, and it can not be unlocked.  Horrible, horrible, horribleexperience, and several lies were told in this ad.  Amazon should do more to protect it's customers when dealing with potential scams.  Your ad said the right thing to getme to buy it, but did not come through with the important details.  This whole ordeal made me real frustrated.

allReviews.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Eh, its Ok
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
allReviews.body: I was really hoping to replace my old Samsung Galaxy S10 with something cheaper and more streamlined and when I saw this phone refurbished for under $90 I couldn't resist the purchase!  But, as is always the case, you get what you pay for.  It runs insanely slow.  I added an SD card thinking I could take some of the heavy lifting off the processor by adding more storage space.  Nada.  I've had to restart it more times than I would like because apps just stop being recognized by the phone.  It drops calls like crazy.  These are all issues I never had with my previous phone and I've lived and worked from home in the same house for over a decade.  I am in no way hard on my phones.  They usually last me 4 or 5 years until the software becomes obsolete.  I play no games and have minimal apps. So its not like I'm pushing this thing overly hard. I probably spend less than an hour every day talking on it and only slightly longer running apps on it.  I have to admit I regret my purchase.  I certainly won't be buying one again and if I didn't desperately need the phone and was capable of dropping $1000 on a newer, better phone, I would get rid of it.  Don't waste your money, even if its not a lot.  It's not worth it.

criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2025
criticalReviews.body: Advertisement said this phone was unlocked.  It wasn't.  In fact, after three days, almost 17 hours of talking on the phone with Assurance, they still could not fully unlock the phone.Also, I did not receive the pointer to take out the SIM tray.  Also, I did not receive a manual.  I understand it was rebuilt, but there had to be a way to provide something.The box did not tell me what the IMEI was.  I had to charge the phone to turn it on, to search for this information on the phone.  According to Assurance Wireless, this was not an Assurance phone, and it can not be unlocked.  Horrible, horrible, horribleexperience, and several lies were told in this ad.  Amazon should do more to protect it's customers when dealing with potential scams.  Your ad said the right thing to getme to buy it, but did not come through with the important details.  This whole ordeal made me real frustrated.

criticalReviews.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Eh, its Ok
criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
criticalReviews.body: I was really hoping to replace my old Samsung Galaxy S10 with something cheaper and more streamlined and when I saw this phone refurbished for under $90 I couldn't resist the purchase!  But, as is always the case, you get what you pay for.  It runs insanely slow.  I added an SD card thinking I could take some of the heavy lifting off the processor by adding more storage space.  Nada.  I've had to restart it more times than I would like because apps just stop being recognized by the phone.  It drops calls like crazy.  These are all issues I never had with my previous phone and I've lived and worked from home in the same house for over a decade.  I am in no way hard on my phones.  They usually last me 4 or 5 years until the software becomes obsolete.  I play no games and have minimal apps. So its not like I'm pushing this thing overly hard. I probably spend less than an hour every day talking on it and only slightly longer running apps on it.  I have to admit I regret my purchase.  I certainly won't be buying one again and if I didn't desperately need the phone and was capable of dropping $1000 on a newer, better phone, I would get rid of it.  Don't waste your money, even if its not a lot.  It's not worth it.

criticalReviews.body: Seemed OK at first, BUT... had to go through a lot of trouble to get the LOCKED phone to connect to my network though it was advertised as unlocked. Reception was way worse than any other phone I have owned on the same network (was eventually diagnosed as a phone problem by the carrier). Battery started dying after a couple of months and is VERY BAD at 4 months. Dead after very little use just for a few calls of a couple hours total.The seller never would replace it or help in any way even though their description said unlocked and the battery was tested to be 80% compared to new.If you want to pay $90.00 for a phone that barely lasts just past the 90 day warranty, buy it. Otherwise, go somewhere else.
